Andy Coulson survives committee hearing MPs treat Andy Coulson with considerable scepticism as he tells him them he knew nothing of the phone hacking happening during his tenure as editor of News of the World. I never condoned the use of phone hacking, nor do I have any recollection of phone hacking taking place, he insists. is launching a new investigation to consider this material.'' Police said the inquiry was being moved from the Metropolitan Police's counter-terrorism command and would now be led by a specialist crime unit. This work will be carried out by the specialist crime directorate which has been investigating a related phone hacking allegation since September 2010, said the police. The News of the World's royal correspondent Clive Goodman was jailed in 2007 for conspiracy to access mobile phone messages involving Princes David Cameron and Harry.
